title: Digital Practice Math Project: Online Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic arithmetic operation skills (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division)
context.additional_context: An asynchronous online course operating in a smartphone-centric, limited technological environment, requiring minimized learner interaction and individualized progress management

learning_goals: Learners can construct and explain the solution process of a system of linear equations to solve real-life problems.
Learners can build simple predictive models based on statistical data and write interpretation reports of the results.
When performing PBL projects, learners can independently conduct the mathematical problem-solving process by more than 80% using digital tools (such as smartphone apps).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
